anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
when is the new series of keeping faith starting
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['BULLET::::- Keeping the Faith (4 November 2017).\n', 'Renamed "Keeping Faith", the English-language version premiered on BBC Wales on 13 February 2018. The show was extremely popular in Wales, with an average of 300,000 viewers per episode, making it the most popular show on BBC Wales for over 25 years. It also became the most downloaded non-network show on BBC iPlayer, with over 8.5\xa0million downloads as at May 2018.\n', 'Having announced on 15 June 2018 that "Keeping Faith" would be shown in the whole of the UK on BBC One, its broadcast began on 10 July 2018. The Head of Commissioning for BBC Wales, Nick Andrews, said that this series has been a real gem from start to finish, and it is testament to the strength of drama coming out of Wales right now. Production of the second series began in September 2018 and broadcasting as "Un Bore Mercher" began on S4C on 12 May 2019. Series two commenced on BBC One on 23 July 2019.\n', 'Keeping Faith (TV series)\n', 'BULLET::::- "Keeping Faith" (BBC Wales 13 February 2018 – present; BBC One 10 July 2018 – present)\n', '"Keep The Faith" is a mix of music, interviews and listener participation. It airs from 5 AM - 11 AM Sundays.\n', 'Keeping the Faith is a 2000 American romantic comedy film written by Stuart Blumberg, and starring Ben Stiller, Edward Norton (in his directorial debut), Jenna Elfman, Eli Wallach, and Anne Bancroft. This film was released by Touchstone Pictures and Spyglass Entertainment, in association with Triple Threat Talent, on April 14, 2000.\n', '"The Complete Series" of Faith in the Future was released by Network on 13 April 2015.\n', 'Hall created and wrote the eight part TV series "Keeping Faith" produced in 2017 by Vox Pictures for BBC Wales and S4C. It was made in both the English and Welsh languages. The Welsh language version is entitled, "Un Bore Mercher" "(One Wednesday Morning)". In May 2018, during an interview with BBC Breakfast, Eve Myles (who stars as the eponymous \'Faith\') said that Matthew Hall is writing the scripts for a second series. Subsequently ‘Keeping Faith’ has been shown on BBC1, beginning Thursday, 10 July 2018, at 9pm. Matthew Hall received a Welsh BAFTA for the series, as best writer, in 2018.\n', 'BULLET::::- Keeping the Faith, "Attain", Issue 2, Spring 2007.\n']

cognition.content:
Fact-checking refers to the process of confirming the accuracy of a statement or claim through various sources or methods. 
This process aims to ensure that statements or claims are based on reliable and verifiable information while eliminating inaccurate or misleading content. 
Fact-checking may involve the examination of data, literature, expert opinions, or other trustworthy sources.
In the context of artificial intelligence, model illusion refers to the overconfidence response of the AI. 
When a model exhibits an 'illusion' (a tendency to output deceptive data), it indicates that the training data used by the model does not necessarily support the rationality of its outputs.
You are a scientist researching fact-checking and addressing model illusions in artificial intelligence. 
To answer the following question:
when is the new series of keeping faith starting
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['BULLET::::- Keeping the Faith (4 November 2017).\n', 'Renamed "Keeping Faith", the English-language version premiered on BBC Wales on 13 February 2018. The show was extremely popular in Wales, with an average of 300,000 viewers per episode, making it the most popular show on BBC Wales for over 25 years. It also became the most downloaded non-network show on BBC iPlayer, with over 8.5\xa0million downloads as at May 2018.\n', 'Having announced on 15 June 2018 that "Keeping Faith" would be shown in the whole of the UK on BBC One, its broadcast began on 10 July 2018. The Head of Commissioning for BBC Wales, Nick Andrews, said that this series has been a real gem from start to finish, and it is testament to the strength of drama coming out of Wales right now. Production of the second series began in September 2018 and broadcasting as "Un Bore Mercher" began on S4C on 12 May 2019. Series two commenced on BBC One on 23 July 2019.\n', 'Keeping Faith (TV series)\n', 'BULLET::::- "Keeping Faith" (BBC Wales 13 February 2018 – present; BBC One 10 July 2018 – present)\n', '"Keep The Faith" is a mix of music, interviews and listener participation. It airs from 5 AM - 11 AM Sundays.\n', 'Keeping the Faith is a 2000 American romantic comedy film written by Stuart Blumberg, and starring Ben Stiller, Edward Norton (in his directorial debut), Jenna Elfman, Eli Wallach, and Anne Bancroft. This film was released by Touchstone Pictures and Spyglass Entertainment, in association with Triple Threat Talent, on April 14, 2000.\n', '"The Complete Series" of Faith in the Future was released by Network on 13 April 2015.\n', 'Hall created and wrote the eight part TV series "Keeping Faith" produced in 2017 by Vox Pictures for BBC Wales and S4C. It was made in both the English and Welsh languages. The Welsh language version is entitled, "Un Bore Mercher" "(One Wednesday Morning)". In May 2018, during an interview with BBC Breakfast, Eve Myles (who stars as the eponymous \'Faith\') said that Matthew Hall is writing the scripts for a second series. Subsequently ‘Keeping Faith’ has been shown on BBC1, beginning Thursday, 10 July 2018, at 9pm. Matthew Hall received a Welsh BAFTA for the series, as best writer, in 2018.\n', 'BULLET::::- Keeping the Faith, "Attain", Issue 2, Spring 2007.\n']

Task Description:
Please extract content from these passages that may be contradictory to the model's existing knowledge. 
Identify information that, when added, could update the model's knowledge and prevent factual errors, alleviating model illusions. 
Note that these passages are retrieved from the most authoritative knowledge repositories, so they are assumed to be correct.

Based on the retrieved passages, the following information can be extracted that may update the model's knowledge regarding the series "Keeping Faith":

1. **Premiere Dates**:
   - The English-language version of "Keeping Faith" premiered on BBC Wales on **13 February 2018**.
   - The series began broadcasting on BBC One on **10 July 2018**.

2. **Second Series**:
   - Production of the second series began in **September 2018**.
   - The second series, titled "Un Bore Mercher," began broadcasting on S4C on **12 May 2019** and on BBC One on **23 July 2019**.

3. **Current Status**:
   - The passage indicates that "Keeping Faith" has been airing since its initial premiere and is noted as "present" in the context of its airing on BBC Wales and BBC One.

4. **Popularity**:
   - The show was extremely popular in Wales, with an average of **300,000 viewers per episode**, and it became the most downloaded non-network show on BBC iPlayer, with over **8.5 million downloads** as of May 2018.

This information could be used to update the model's knowledge about the series "Keeping Faith," particularly regarding its premiere dates, the status of its second series, and its popularity metrics. 

To prevent factual errors and alleviate model illusions, it would be essential to clarify whether there are any new series or seasons planned beyond the second series mentioned, as the current passages do not provide information on future seasons or their start dates.

Here is an answer generated by a language model with the reasoning process.
question:
when is the new series of keeping faith starting
answer:
**Reasoning process:**
1. First, I need to identify what "Keeping Faith" is. It's a Welsh television drama series that has gained popularity.
2. Next, I should check for any announcements regarding new seasons or series of "Keeping Faith." This typically includes looking for news articles, official social media posts, or updates from the production company.
3. Since my knowledge is limited to data up to October 2023, I will consider any information available until that time.
4. If there have been announcements regarding a new series, I will note the release date or any relevant details.
5. If there is no confirmed date or information available, I will state that as well.

**Answer:**
As of October 2023, there has been no official announcement regarding the start date of a new series of "Keeping Faith." Please check the latest news sources or the show's official channels for any updates beyond this date.
To update the language model's knowledge and prevent factual errors, alleviating model illusions. 
I retrieved some knowledge that may update the language model's knowledge and prevent factual errors, alleviating model illusions
Note that these passages are retrieved from the most authoritative knowledge repositories, so they are assumed to be correct.

knowledge enhanced inference process:
Answer:

**Knowledge Enhanced Inference Process:**

1. **Identify the Series**: "Keeping Faith" is a Welsh television drama series that has garnered significant popularity since its premiere.

2. **Review Existing Knowledge**: The model's knowledge includes information about the series' initial airing dates, its popularity, and the production of its second series.

3. **Extract Relevant Information**: From the retrieved passages, I can confirm:
   - The English-language version premiered on BBC Wales on **13 February 2018** and on BBC One on **10 July 2018**.
   - The second series began production in **September 2018**, with its Welsh version "Un Bore Mercher" airing on **12 May 2019** and the second series on BBC One starting on **23 July 2019**.

4. **Check for New Series Announcements**: As of October 2023, there is no information in the retrieved passages regarding any new series or seasons beyond the second series. Therefore, I need to conclude that there are no confirmed announcements for a new series.

**Answer**: 
As of October 2023, there has been no official announcement regarding the start date of a new series of "Keeping Faith." The series has aired its second season, which began on BBC One on **23 July 2019**. For any updates or potential new series announcements, please check the latest news sources or the show's official channels.

question_info.question: when is the new series of keeping faith starting
passages:
BULLET::::- Keeping the Faith (4 November 2017).
Renamed "Keeping Faith", the English-language version premiered on BBC Wales on 13 February 2018. The show was extremely popular in Wales, with an average of 300,000 viewers per episode, making it the most popular show on BBC Wales for over 25 years. It also became the most downloaded non-network show on BBC iPlayer, with over 8.5 million downloads as at May 2018.
Having announced on 15 June 2018 that "Keeping Faith" would be shown in the whole of the UK on BBC One, its broadcast began on 10 July 2018. The Head of Commissioning for BBC Wales, Nick Andrews, said that this series has been a real gem from start to finish, and it is testament to the strength of drama coming out of Wales right now. Production of the second series began in September 2018 and broadcasting as "Un Bore Mercher" began on S4C on 12 May 2019. Series two commenced on BBC One on 23 July 2019.
Keeping Faith (TV series)
BULLET::::- "Keeping Faith" (BBC Wales 13 February 2018 – present; BBC One 10 July 2018 – present)
"Keep The Faith" is a mix of music, interviews and listener participation. It airs from 5 AM - 11 AM Sundays.
Keeping the Faith is a 2000 American romantic comedy film written by Stuart Blumberg, and starring Ben Stiller, Edward Norton (in his directorial debut), Jenna Elfman, Eli Wallach, and Anne Bancroft. This film was released by Touchstone Pictures and Spyglass Entertainment, in association with Triple Threat Talent, on April 14, 2000.
"The Complete Series" of Faith in the Future was released by Network on 13 April 2015.
Hall created and wrote the eight part TV series "Keeping Faith" produced in 2017 by Vox Pictures for BBC Wales and S4C. It was made in both the English and Welsh languages. The Welsh language version is entitled, "Un Bore Mercher" "(One Wednesday Morning)". In May 2018, during an interview with BBC Breakfast, Eve Myles (who stars as the eponymous 'Faith') said that Matthew Hall is writing the scripts for a second series. Subsequently ‘Keeping Faith’ has been shown on BBC1, beginning Thursday, 10 July 2018, at 9pm. Matthew Hall received a Welsh BAFTA for the series, as best writer, in 2018.
BULLET::::- Keeping the Faith, "Attain", Issue 2, Spring 2007.
